Context:
Program Name: Mobile Application Development and Strategy
Code: T440
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $6,137.00 *
International Tuition: $18,603.00 **
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Experiential Learning: Mandatory Co-op or Work Integrated Project
Program Overview: Equips students with skills related to developing, testing, and deploying apps for iOS and Android devices.
Learning Platforms: iOS and Android
Programming Languages: Kotlin and Swift
Client-side development tools: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript
Server-side programming
Co-op work term or applied project available.

* Domestic tuition fee for the first year (as of current academic year)
** International tuition fee for the first year (as of current academic year)

Context:
Program Information:
- Name: Mobile Application Development and Entrepreneurship
- Semesters: 3
- Required Courses in Semester 1:
  - MADS 4001: Introduction to Android Development
  - MADS 4006: Advanced Android Development
  - MADS 4007: Web Development Fundamentals
  - MADS 4012: Full Stack Development
  - MADS 4013: Introduction to Kotlin
- Required Courses in Semester 2:
  - MADS 4002: Swift Fundamentals
  - MADS 4003: Introduction to IOS Development
  - MADS 4005: Advanced IOS Development
  - MADS 4009: Mobile Application Strategy
  - MADS 4014: Cross Platform Mobile Development
  - COMP 4064: Career Planning and Portfolio Development
- Required Courses in Semester 3:
  - TCOP 4010: Co-op or
  - MADS 4010: Work-Integrated Project

Technology Requirements:
- Operating System: Mac is recommended
- RAM: minimum 16 GB, optimal 500+ GB
- Hard Drive: 256 GB SSD, minimum
- Processor: Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better
- Video Card: 2GB RAM minimum, 4GB RAM recommended
- Webcam

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Create meaningful design artifacts using modern software engineering methodologies and project management principles.
- Implement native mobile applications for different mobile platforms.
- Develop solution architectures to support mobile applications by applying enterprise architecture principles and best practices.
- Develop creative concepts for mobile applications that meet innovation, entrepreneurship and social enterprise objectives.
- Develop secure mobile applications by implementing the security principles, standards and best practices.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Mobile Application Development and Strategy Program (Postgraduate) T440 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Objectives:
- Develop secure mobile applications by implementing security principles, standards, and best practices of mobile application development.
- Create usable, friendly, fast, and reliable mobile applications through User Interface design and experience (UI/UX) principles and best practices.
- Work independently and in teams to develop mobile application solutions for businesses.
- Use industry-standard testing methodologies to ensure software quality and improve performance.
- Apply various strategies for developing competitive mobile applications.

Tuition & Fees:
[Domestic Students]
- Tuition: $6,137.00 (first two semesters of the program starting in Fall 2023)
- Additional Costs: Subject to change
- Co-op placement or work-integrated project fee (Semester 3): $500 (not included in the total above)

[International Students]
- Tuition: $18,603.00 (first two semesters of the program starting in Fall 2023)
- Additional Costs: Subject to change

Financial Assistance:
- Approved for OSAP funding if applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria

Admission Requirements:
- Two- or three-year college diploma or bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
- English language proficiency is essential; international students without English test results must be assessed at the college level.

Context:
To apply for admission to George Brown College, domestic students should visit Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the International Admissions page for country-specific requirements. The English proficiency level required can be found on the English Proficiency page, and course exemptions may be granted based on college or university credits; more information can be obtained from the Transfer Guide.

For queries related to the School of Computer Technology, contact Maziar Masoudi at 416-415-5000 ext. 3345 or [mmasoudi@georgebrown.ca](mailto:mmasoudi@georgebrown.ca). The office hours are Monday – Friday: 9 a.m. – 4 p.m. Additionally, information sessions and campus tours can be scheduled for the Casa Loma Campus at 146 Kendal Avenue, and international recruitment representatives can be contacted via virtual meetings or inquiries on the International Contact Us page.

The Mobile Application Development and Strategy program is offered through the School of Computer Technology from the Casa Loma Campus. You may contact the George Brown College Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002 for more information, or visit the campus.

Related programs include:
- Computer Programming and Analysis (T177)
- Information Systems Business Analysis (with experiential learning capstone) (Postgraduate) (T405)
- Computer Systems Technology (T147)

To learn more about George Brown College, book an information session or campus tour, get answers to your questions, and sign up to receive tailored resources for application, visit the college's website. Ensure that you have JavaScript enabled to use the form.
